development.title: 1X2
development.description: The 1X2 is a Reprap class 3D-printer that can be built with access to only a drill-press and hand-saw. All the parts can be made with one-dimensional tools and straight cuts. Even with these limited requirements, it is designed to be easy to build and have a full set of features.
development.goalsDescription: The parts for the entire system can be made with one-dimensional tools, straight cuts and common materials.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: 1X2 Shortcat
development.description: The SHORTCAT is a 18″ tall, 12″ wide Pyramid framed 3D printer.
development.goalsDescription: The SHORTCAT applies TALLCAT style design in a more compact form factor.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: 1X2 Tallcat
development.description: The 3ft tall 1X2 "TALLCAT" has the enormous vertical build area of 640mm, yet it takes up no more desk space than the "Compact" Reprap 1X2. It has an increased X and Y build area as well.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: 2 Extruder Mod for Prusa Mendel

connections.connection: Lm8uu X Carriage with Fan Mount for Prusa Mendel

development.description: "This is a 2 extruder mod for Prusa Mendel 3D printer." - including notes on the electronics and software.

development.title: 3 Jaw Z Coupling for Prusa Mendel
development.description: This is a new 3-jaw coupling that allows z alignment adjustment.
development.goalsDescription: Print without any Z wobble.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: 3D Tin
development.description: Online 3D modelling tool.

development.title: 3DTouch
development.description: "3DTouch (TM) Personal color 3D Printer. It is easy to set up and easy to use with a touch screen user interface, and is ideal for desktop 3D printing in the home, classroom and office."

development.title: 555 timer controlled heated print bed
development.description: PCB heated bed with a standalone 555-timer based controller.

development.title: Accessible Wade's Extruder
development.description: This is an extruder based strongly on the wades from the Prusa git repo. It has several features over the standard wade: + Accessible hobbing + The motor can be removed without removing the large gear. + Slightly higher gear ratio than standard wade. This design uses 43:10 instead of 37:11.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2
development.notice: Superseded by Greg's Hinged Accessible Extruder.

development.title: Alu RepRap
development.description: Derivative of the Parametric Printrbot using aluminium sheet for the base and integrating other changes.

development.title: Aluminum Mendel
development.description: "This MendelMax inspired printer is compact, lightweight, and totally self contained. Nothing protrudes beyond the frame. Z axis motors are mounted low, and thrust bearings carry the weight. Note that the z axis uses the aluminum extrusion for a guide, saving space and expense. The linear bearings and belt and pulley upgrades give high quality prints. All dimensions are chosen so that you can use 4 smooth rods and 2 threaded rods, plus all other parts from you mendel."

development.title: Arcol.hu Hot-End
development.description: Commercial hot-end from Arcol.hu

development.title: Ausxmods Pulley for Prusa Mendel
development.description: "When I printed the standard pulley from the Prusa git repository, I found that my T5 belt didn't quite fit it and the belt would ride up on the teeth. In response to this, I modified the design iteratively, just printing the tooth portion until I came up with a design that meshed nicely with the Ausxmods T5 belt (http://ausxmods.com.au/t5-timing-belts)."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Auto retracting z-probe
development.description: A probe that can make Z measurements and then retract itself out of the way. It was designed for HydraRaptor but can probably be adapted for other wooden machines like Makerbot.
development.goalsDescription: Z-axis calibration

development.title: Bamboo Hot-End
development.description: Bamboo as an Alternative to PEEK or PTFE
development.goalsDescription: PEEK and PTFE are too expensive to use in experimental hot ends and quite difficult to come by.

development.title: Banate CAD
development.description: Banate CAD is a text based visualization and 3D modeling tool.

development.title: Birdstruder for MakerGear Plastruder
development.description: "This is an extruder block designed for the MakerGear Plastruder that allows for quick change of filament and easy clean up after a filament strip."

development.title: Bolt Hobbing Tool
development.description: I designed this tool to help me hob a toothed channel in a drive bolt for a wade's extruder.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Brazilian Study Group Heated Bed
development.description: Details the construction of a power-resistor based heated bed.

development.title: Brazilian Study Group Hot End
development.description: Details the construction of a heater block Hot End.

development.title: Brutstruder
development.description: An extremely reliable, no compromise, multi platform extruder, that builds on all the most successful ideas currently available in thermoplastic extrusion.
development.goalsDescription: "An extremely reliable, no compromise, extruder for the Makerbot, that builds on all the most successful ideas currently available in thermoplastic extrusion."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Brutstruder RepRap
development.description: "This is exactly the same as Brustruder for Makerbot, just cut down to it's essential size (a 1/3 reduction:) ). Brutstruder is specifically designed as a RepRap Huxley gearmotor extruder, but no reason why it would not work just as well as a Mendel Extruder with the proper mounting bracket."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: BudaSchnozzle
development.description: * Aluminum Block Resistor Hotend * Easily assembled and torn down with no glue or ceramic * Wire Strain Relief * Includes machined aluminum and steel parts, and laser cut wooden parts * Compatible with Wade's and Greg's accessible extruder * Currently compatible with the standard Prusa Mendel carriage or our Supa-Flat carriage
development.license: The GNU General Public License v3

development.title: Cartesio
development.description: "Cartesio is a printed multi-purpose desktop CNC machine, with a working space of 300x200x100mm(X,Y,Z). The machine is designed to hold multiple tools at its toolhead. This way one could connect a mill and/or a 3Dprint extruder and/or...."

development.title: Clonedel
development.description: The Clonedel is a RepStrap design which is essentially a Prusa Mendel that is modified for easy casting.

development.title: Fab@Home - Model 1
development.description:
The Fab@Home is a machine that prints static and dynamic three-dimensional objects.
The Model 1 is the original Fab@Home fabber.
development.goalsDescription: "The goals of the Fab@Home project are first and foremost to facilitate the democratization of innovation by giving each household the ability to physically create their ideas."

development.title: Fab@Home - Model 2
development.description: The Model 2.0 is the latest printer in the Fab@Home family. The design has been simplified to reduce cost, build time, and required skill level.

development.title: Felix 1.0
development.description: Commercial 3D kit based on an extruded Aluminium frame.

development.title: Filabot: Plastic Filament Maker
development.description: "Filabot is a 3D plastic extrusion system. For example mostly any type of recyclable plastic, such as milk jugs, detergent bottles, soda bottles, shampoo bottles, product packaging, and many more, can be processed through the Filabot to make usable 3D printing filament. This will allow for users to remake filament from an old print that is bad or not needed. The Filabot will grind, melt and extrude the plastic filament. It is a one stop shop for all the filament you could ever need. "

development.title: Hollow Mini-Mendel
development.description: "This is a Mini-Mendel ( thingiverse.com/thing:1745 ) where many parts have been shelled (hollowed out) to 1mm (some 1.5 or 2mm for better printability). This shall allow to use even less material in printing and apply the material where it counts for the mechanical structure (2-3 shell layers but very sparse infill)."

development.title: Huxley-eg
development.description: "Just an idea (not particularly for the huxley, but when choosing an order of scale I found it sufficient) : for less shaking at high-speed put the extruder axis perpendicular to the triangular frame (for more resistance and thus maybe allowing more speed ?). While the mass of the bed rest at the base."

development.description: "This solution take all the downwards strain that is applied on your z motors away from the stepper shaft and transfer it to the bearing and bearing holder. This way the only job for the Z stepper motor is to make the rotational torque"

development.title: J Head Nozzle
development.description: J-Head Nozzle and Thermal Barrier Based on a combination of ideas from the Makerbot Mk 5 hot end, The Inline Heater Variation, some ideas from Brian Briggs, and some ideas from me.

development.description: "KISSlicer aims to be a fast and easy-to-use slicer. Taking one or many STL files, it converts them into G-Code necessary to build the model on an additive extrusion 3D printer."

development.description: Detailed instructions on how to make a Stereolithography 3D printer (Resin cured by UV light).

development.title: MakerBot Stepstruder MK6 Plus
development.description: The MakerBot Stepstruder MK6+ is just what you'd think -- all the direct-driven, controllable, torquey goodness of the MK6, with an added plus! That plus is a new, quicker-heating aluminum heater core, powered by a custom-made cartridge heater. In addition to faster heating performance, the MK6 Plus is easier to put together and has fewer points of potential failure.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: MakerBot Stepstruder MK7
development.description: The MakerBot® Stepstruder® MK7 is an all-new extruder which was designed from the ground up exclusively for 1.75 mm filament.

development.description: A (relatively) compact geared extruder.

development.title: Mattroberts' Firmware
development.description: Experimental firmware introducing "pressure management code– which allows for acceleration while printing (if tuned correctly)".

development.title: Meehl Drive Extruder
development.description: "This is an early concept for a belt driven extruder. The extruder motor (E Motor) is moved from the X carriage and mounted at the x end. Force is transferred via a differential."

development.title: Mega Mendel
development.description:
Giant version of Mendel.
It is a mighty machine with a build envelope of 766mm x 453mm x 497mm.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Mendel
development.description: The second, improved version of RepRap.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Mendel Heated Bed
development.description: Mendel Dibond heated bed.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Mendel X Y axis accuracy doubling mod
development.description: This mod doubles the X Y axis's accuracy on Reprap Mendel. It does this by creating a double pulley system. I have noticed that there is significantly less lash on my x axis now and everything seems to move more sharply. Another benefit is this mod allows your machine to run at exactly the same speed as before.
development.goalsDescription: Improve accuracy of Reprap Mendel.

development.title: Mendel90
development.description: Nophead's redesign of the Mendel, aiming for a sturdier, more robust printer.

development.title: MendelMax
development.description: "MendelMax is a new RepRap 3d printer designed by Maxbots. It is a true reprap, using printed brackets, but instead of using threaded rod for the structural elements it uses inexpensive aluminum extrusions. This gives a huge increase in rigidity for a minimal extra cost (Self sourcing will cost about $50 more than a standard Prusa when purchased from the recommended suppliers). The required extrusions are available world wide from a variety of suppliers."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: MetalicaRap
development.description: An Electron Beam 3D Metal Powder Printer with Solar Cell Fab. ability, including microscope vision system (SEM) & Z axis metal correction in a vacuum.(Design stage).
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Mini Prusa
development.description: A smaller version of the Prusa by prusajr.

development.title: Mini-Mendel/Huxley RepRap Printer Foot
development.description: A small foot that can clip onto the 6mm bars of a Mini-Mendel/Huxley RepRap printer.

development.title: Mixer extruder
development.description: "A mixer extrusion system that would take multiple (4) filaments and push them out of the same nozzle. It will be a Bowden design. It will allow colour mixing, and also things like combining flexible and rigid versions of the same polymer in different mix ratios. Plus you'd be able to mix polymers carrying different modifiers like plain, plain plus ferrite, or plain plus dendritic silver and so on."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: MK5-6 Stepstruder NEMA 23 Direct Drive Pivoting Filament Pusher
development.description: This is a direct drive extruder mechanism that fits with the hotend and dinos of a MK5-6. I wanted to move to a stepper drive extruder but didn't want to wait three weeks for makerbot to ship their new beefy nema 17. I also had a lot of issues with the delrin plunger.

development.title: Moineau stepper extruder
development.description: "Paste extruder based on the Moineau pump principle."

development.title: Multiple filament bowden extruder drive
development.description: "This is a proof of concept in the use of driving more than 2 filaments (3 here) using 2 motors. one motor drives the filament while the other drives a cam that pushes the filament into the drive shaft."

development.title: NEMA 14 Wade
development.description:
This extruder is desgined to fit on the Mini Prusa X carraige.
It uses a NEMA 14 stepper motor, M8 hobbed bolt and 3 608 bearings.
development.goalsDescription: Made for the Mini Prusa
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: NEMA 17 Bowden Extruder Drive
development.description:
"Based on Wade's extruder, with the X carriage mounting holes removed since this will be mounted on the Huxley frame instead. Also includes some other changes to take the bowden tube (3mm OD) and work with a 1.75mm diameter filament, driven by an M4 toothed brass insert."
(Note: can also be used with 3mm filament)
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: No-lathe Plumstruder
development.description: "A hotend made of common, readily available materials that requires no special tools to build. It uses Nopheads vitreous enamel resistor heater design to provide stable temperatures and is based on his Plumstruder"

development.title: Nophead's Drive Method Research (Hobbing & Knurling)
development.description: Testing of knurling and hobbing as method of driving the filament.

development.title: Nophead's Heated Bed Research
development.description: A series of blog posts researching various heated bed materials and ideas.

development.title: North90's Hot-end
development.description: "This design is great for everyone who wants to build a Hot End but who doesn't have access to a lathe, cnc-machine and drill-press."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: North90's hot-end V2
development.description: "This is an upgrade of: North90's hot-end This Hot End is designed to be build with simple tools and without the need for great engineering skills."
development.goalsDescription: Main differences with hot-end v1: no thread tapping needed nozzle is hold in place by crimping with a tube-cutter nozzle to insulator attachment is more leak proof
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Number Six's Extruder Hot-end v1
development.description: "I've been trying to come up with an extruder 'hot-end' design that doesn't use the expensive PEEK material that is in common use in other designs. My initial thoughts have been to use a salvaged heat-sink, clamping the feed shaft from the hot-end heater, and using a small fan to cool the heat-sink."

development.title: Number Six's Extruder Hot-end v2
development.description: An all-metal hot-end based on a heat sink and fan.

development.title: OpenJsCad
development.description: "This is intended to become a Javascript based alternative to OpenSCAD, for 3D solid modeling. CSG model is contructed using Javascript."

development.title: OpenSCAD
development.description:
The Programmers Solid 3D CAD Modeller.
OpenSCAD is not an interactive modeller. Instead it is something like a 3D-compiler that reads in a script file that describes the object and renders the 3D model from this script file.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Prusa Inspired x-axis for Huxley
development.description: "During the build of my Huxley, i found that the x-axis was quite complicated compared to Prusa's Mendel. This is my take on his work to suit Huxley. These two parts replace the 12 needed for the origional x axis (plus 10 bearings!)."

development.title: Prusa Mendel
development.description: The Prusa Mendel is a simpler remix of the original Mendel.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Prusa Mendel PLA Coupling
development.description: After repeated failures of the standard z-axis rod coupling, a need for a more robust coupler was determined. This coupler has separate clamps for the 3/16th drive rod and the motor shaft, centering both without stretching the PLA too much. Additionally, it has recesses for the nuts, allowing very easy tightening and adjustments. This design however uses 4 bolts and nuts instead of 2.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Prusa Mendel Visual Instructions
development.description: Providing a visual guide to the steps given on the reprap.org wiki page on how to construct a Prusa Mendel.
development.goalsDescription: Provide an instruction manual as easy to follow as Lego or Meccanno booklets.

development.title: Repetier-Host
development.description: Software for controlling RepRap style 3D-printer like Mendel, Darwin or Prusa mendel. Works with most firmware types. It is optimized to work with Repetier-Firmware.

development.title: ReplicatorG
development.description: "This is the software that will drive your MakerBot Thing-O-Matic, CupCake CNC, RepRap machine, or generic CNC machine. You can give it a GCode or STL file to process, and it takes it from there. Its cross platform, easily installed, and is based on the familiar Arduino / Processing environments."

development.title: Reprap Pascal Half Frame
development.description:
Concept of a reprap printer using a 1/2 frame approach.
"Big, Bulky, sturdy plastic pieces to reduce the amount of non plastic pieces needed, make the whole thing more stable, and easier to assemble."

development.title: RepRap Universal Mini Extruder

connections.connection: MK5-6 Stepstruder NEMA 23 Direct Drive Pivoting Filament Pusher

development.description: This printable extruder is intended to work on RepRap Mendel (both standard and Prusa), RepRap Huxley, and virtually any other open-source 3D printer you can find.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: RepRapPro Huxley
development.description: The RepRapPro version of the RepRap Huxley.

development.title: RepSnapper
development.description: RepSnapper RepRap control software

development.title: RepStrap Jibaro
development.description:
The RepStrap Jibaro presents ideas replacing all of the plastic parts of a Prusa-type RepRap, with easy to source materials found in many hardware stores. It came about as and exercise to build a RepRap while on vacation in Puerto Rico, using only local sources for hardware, tools, and electronics.
The term Jibaro, refers to the mountain folk of the island, known for their fierce indepencence, conservatism and artistic creativity.
development.goalsDescription: The RepStrap Jibaro presents ideas replacing all of the plastic parts of a Prusa-type RepRap, with easy to source materials found in many hardware stores.

development.title: Ronthomp Mendel
development.description: Mendel derivative with the aim of reducing parts count and using less hardware.

development.title: Rook 3D Printer
development.description: Mendel-class printer using Misumi rails for frame structure.
development.notice: Author has blogged that development is on hold.

development.title: RusRap
development.description:
Aka: 3D принтер RusRap
"Bring to your attention the domestic counterpart to the popular, and most importantly, a portable 3D-printer RepRap - RusRap. Our printer is a modified version of Prusa." (via Google Translate)

development.title: Rusty Huxley
development.description: This is a redesigned Huxley inspired by the Prusa simplified Mendel.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Sanguinololu
development.description: Sanguinololu is a low-cost all-in-one electronics solution for Reprap and other CNC devices.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Securing a plastic filament extruder hot end with wire
development.description: A quick tip on securing an extruder with wire.

development.title: SFACT
development.description: A modified Skeinforge to be more prectical and easier to tune.
development.license: The GNU Affero General Public License

development.title: Shapercube
development.description: Shapercube is a 3D Printer, inspired by the model "Darwin" of the Reprap Project. While mechanically a complete redesign, it stays fully compatibe with the Reprap license (GPL v2).
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Sharebot Kiwi
development.description: "This is the prototype of a 3D printer built by cutting and engraving a composite of aluminum and PET, subsequently folded (by hand) and fixed by self-tapping screws."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Simpler hot-end
development.description: This hot end is the result of my attempt to build the Wildseyed Simple Hot End by jcabrer for my Simpler repstrap.

development.title: Skeinforge
development.description: Skeinforge is a tool chain composed of Python scripts that converts your 3d model into G-Code instructions.
development.license: The GNU Affero General Public License

development.title: Slic3r
development.description: STL to GCODE translator written in Perl.
development.license: Dual-licensed under the Perl Artistic License and the AGPLv3

development.title: SLS wax printer
development.description: "The Reprap and other FDM printers that fabricate in PLA and ABS are restricted both by the limitations inherent in these materials and by the limitations of the FDM process. Though these printers are entirely capable of self-replication and of producing parts for a variety of light-duty applications, they cannot produce pieces that can replace the cast aluminum parts found in power machinery, CNC equipment, or in numerous other high-strength applications. To address the problem of rapid fabrication in metal, I sidestepped plasma jets, electric arcs, and high-power lasers by opting instead to employ the lost-wax casting technique coupled with a relatively low-power laser sintering system."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Slugstruder 1.0 - lightweight flexible shaft extruder
development.description: "This is a lightweight flexible shaft extruder, that i designed for highspeed printing. The idea was to keep the stepper away from the moving parts so not too much mass has to be accelerated without the disadvantages of a bowden-extruder."
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Snapdragon RepRap
development.description: The Snapdragon takes self-replication to a new level. The entire frame and print bed can be RP printed. The build surface area can be increased by adding joiner plates at each of the corners. I suppose we could even do away with the #6 screws, and nuts, and replace them with filament as cotter pins, but I'll resist that idea until I get the first prototype built.

development.title: Solidoodle
development.description: Solidoodle 3D Printer

development.title: Sprinter
development.description:
Firmware for RepRap printers and similar devices.
This is a firmware for RAMPS and other reprap single-processor electronics setups. It supports printing from SD card, active heatbed control, and ATmega internal pullups.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Sumpod
development.description: When I designed the SUMPOD I had one aim, to produce a high quality but affordable and safe desktop 3d Printer. After many months of designing, testing, redesigning and retesting I have produced a product that not only matches all the original goals but exceeds them.

development.title: Tantillus
development.description: The portable self replicating mini printer.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v3

development.title: TechZone Huxley
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Test Tube Mendel
development.description: The Test Tube Mendel design is a minimal printed parts Mendel designed for rapid and cheap duplication. It is built around the vinyl-washer vertex proposed by Mrkim on thingiverse.

development.title: The Fablicator
development.description: "The printer was designed and built from scratch, and uses aluminum T-slot, 12mm linear bearings, and active hot end cooling to achieve excellent print quality."

development.title: The Quantum ORD Bot
development.description: "This is the Quantum ORD Bot. It is 3D printer mech platform made from MakerSlide linear bearing. It is extremly ridged and very easy to build. The design can easily be scaled in X,Y and/or Z by simply changing the Makerslide lengths plus belt and leadscrew lengths. This is the mini or 'Quantum' version. The parts other than MakerSlide are either off the shelf standard items or easily fabricate with a laser cutter, 3D printer or CNC router."

development.title: The Ten Dollar Heated Printbed
development.description: Cheap heated bed from copper proto-boards.

development.title: Thing-O-Matic
development.description: The MakerBot Thing-O-Matic® 3D Printer kit you assemble to create the latest in cutting edge personal manufacturing technology. Includes the new StepStruder® MK6 Plus Complete Upgrade!
development.license: The GNU General Public License v3

development.title: Tilt printer
development.description: "Print onto ABP [Automated Build Platform] with stepper as the Z axis, and canter the Y axis at 45deg which may allow very long prints."

development.title: Tilt WadeExtruder
development.description: Wade style extruder for Tilt Printer (excluding hot end). Will fit on a cupcake with ABP [Automated Build Platform]

development.title: Tinkercad

development.title: Transport screw workaround for wade extruder
development.description: Method of creating a toothed bolt for use in a Wade's style extruder.

development.title: Ultimaker Protobox

development.title: Ultimaker Z-axis end-switch fine-adjuster
development.description: Enables you to fine-adjust the zero set-pooint of the Z-stage of the Ultimaker.

development.title: UP! Personal Portable 3D Printer

development.description: Experimental extruder improvement that uses a solenoid to close and open the nozzle, with the goal of eliminating ooze.

development.title: Wildseyed Hot End
development.description:
This hot end design is for anyone with limited access to tools, and supplies. The main components can be found in any good hardware store, and the component count is small.
Preparation and assembly require only basic tools, and a drill press (or hand drill if you are skilled).

development.title: X-Carriage-Struder (Vert-X)
development.description: A direct-drive extruder/x-carriage for the V9 hotend (for the moment) and its whole vertical x-axis.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2

development.title: Yet Another Prusa Mendel Z Coupling
development.description: Couples a 5mm motor shaft to an 8mm threaded rod, ensuring they are coaxial, but allowing some angular movement if the rod is not straight.
development.license: The GNU General Public License v2
